page.title: 11New industry in Patricroft
page.content: On the site of Patricroft Engine Sheds and sidings (closed in 1966) there is a small, active light industrial estate (768 989) which is still being built. It will house ten firms and at the moment therer are mainly wholesale, service industries and light industries accomodated in single storey factory units. Industry on the banks of both the Ship Canal and the Bridgewater Canal has declined and attempts to rebuild in the area are not meeting with much success at the moment. There are two vacant factory sites at 767 979 and 769 978. There is no commercial traffic now along the Bridgewater Canal but the Barton Swing Aqueduct which carries the Bridgewater Canal over the Manchester Ship Canal is still open, carrying weekend liesure traffic.
